newsitem.title: KENYA: Army worms threaten crops on Kenyan coast.
newsitem.headline: Army worms threaten crops on Kenyan coast.

text.p: Kenya's harvest, already hit by late rain, is faced with another threat -- army worms which agriculture ministry officials say are devouring everything in their wake.

At least four districts in Coast Province -- Kilifi, Kwale, Malindi and Mombasa -- have been invaded by the green grubs which are threatening to wipe out about 73,000 hectares of maize and bean crops, they said.
Agriculture ministry officials on Thursday distributed emergency supplies of pesticides to farmers from the four districts.
Officials said the worm infestation appeared to have been sparked by the arrival of the late but torrential rains which have lashed the coast in the past week.
